actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of May 18, 89 with amendments. With written report No. 101-33.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 71.
Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.
Held at the desk.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Considered by unanimous consent.
The House struck all after the enacting clause and inserted in lieu thereof the provisions of a similar measure H.R. 2539. Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed without objection.
The title of the measure was amended to that of similar measure H.R. 2539. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
A similar measure H.R. 2539 was laid on the table without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Senate concurred in House amendments with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Sharp asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendments.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendments Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-46.

official_title: A bill to amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to extend the authority for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve and for other purposes.

summary.as: Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment
summary.text: Amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to extend from June 30, 1989, to April 1, 1990, the authority granted under the Act regarding domestic energy supply availability, especially the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. Directs the Secretary of Energy to report by a specified date to certain congressional committees regarding alternative means of financing the filling of the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to 1,000,000,000 barrels (including specified aspects of long-term leasing of crude oil and storage facilities from both foreign and domestic entities). Sets October 15, 1989, as the deadline for an interim report, and February 1, 1990, as the deadline for the final report. Imposes a moratorium upon Department of Energy sales of oil from the Naval Petroleum Reserve at Elk Hills (except to the Strategic Petroleum Reserve) until such final report has been submitted.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to extend the authority for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve and for other purposes.
